desc.value: [MaintenanceCenter]s are an excellent way to reduce [!Upkeep]. Try to cover your territory with their effect.
Add crew to your [Harvester]s to increase their daily yield of [Spice].
Assign an [Ornithopter] to a [Harvester] to detect [Sandworm]s and reduce its chance of being eaten.
[Fremen] [F_Harvester_Mobile]s are built directly from the units interface. They can exploit any neutral or controlled [SpiceArea]s.
You can save multiplayer games. Load them through the "LOAD SAVE" button in the Multiplayer screen, and invite the game's players to finish it.
Feeling overwhelmed? You can always pause the game by pressing [Time_PauseResume] or clicking the pause icon in the upper right corner.
Feeling overwhelmed? You can always pause the game by pressing [Time_PauseResume].
To catch the attention of your teammates on a position, ping them with [Ping_Team].
The slider next to [Spice] production can be raised or lowered to change how much [Spice] is sold to the CHOAM or stockpiled to fulfill your contract.
Sandworms cannot eat your units if they are on rocky ground or near a cliff.
Military and Statecraft buildings have higher [!Upkeep]. Be sure to not build more than you can afford.
You can see and change every key binding in the options.
If your economy is slow, it might be a good idea to destroy a few buildings with high [!Upkeep]. You will be refunded a part of their cost.
Military units participating in a kill earn experience points. With enough points they'll gain a level, increasing their strength.
Losing a battle is not losing the war. Skirmishes are never lost before you can see the Defeat screen.
There are many ways leading to victory. Winning in skirmish is often more about appearing unthreatening and manipulating your opponents than being outright stronger.
